p: By focusing on specific types of immunity over others, a vaccination programme may shift the landscape of population immunity in unexpected ways, particularly in settings such as the USA, where routine coverage already exceeds 40% of the population [ 17]. The development of universal influenza vaccines is still in its early stages; in the absence of large-scale trials, mathematical modelling can be a helpful tool for generating some preliminary insights into the potential population implications of these vaccines. Here we have illustrated two potential risks.
